intro: Micrampelis fabacea, commonly known as the African star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped white flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has strap-like, grassy leaves and produces small, red berries that contain seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils. Micrampelis fabacea is also valued for its resilience to drought and its role in supporting local wildlife.
